channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-18379] ALTER TABLE authorization_part SET PROPERTIES ("PARTITIONL_LEVEL_PRIVILEGE"="TRUE"); fails when authorization_part is MicroManaged table.
item.description:
ALTER TABLE authorization_part SET TBLPROPERTIES ("PARTITION_LEVEL_PRIVILEGE"="TRUE") fails when authorization_part is a Micromanaged table.
This is from authorization_2.q qtest.
item.summary: ALTER TABLE authorization_part SET PROPERTIES ("PARTITIONL_LEVEL_PRIVILEGE"="TRUE"); fails when authorization_part is MicroManaged table.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12905311 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Hey Sergey..
"ALTER TABLE authorization_part SET PROPERTIES ("PARTITIONL_LEVEL_PRIVILEGE"="TRUE");" is the statement
and this statement simply fails since this isToInsertOnlyTable() returns non-null object.

So for an alter statement case like the above has null value for 'transactional' and 'transactionalProp' in isToInsertOnlyTable().
You are right. The conditional statement "If (transactional == null)" may be sufficient.
But I just used the existing logic of checking both and changed the location of the statement.
Was little bit cautious: did not want to change the existing behavior but wanted to fix the issue
found with this defect.
Trimmed the whitespace that the p-test was complaining about.

Hi Eugene Koifman Can you take a look?
Thanks,
Steve.

+1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12905526 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

The one test failure: org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestNegativeCliDriver.testCliDriver[stats_aggregator_error_1)
is not related to this patch. I have tested.

Steve.
+1 for patch 5

committed to master
thanks Steve for the contribution
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
